info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Laurens, south central Greenville, east central Anderson, northeastern Abbeville and north central Greenwood Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles west of Laurens, or near Ware Shoals, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laurens, Ware Shoals, Waterloo, Lake Greenwood, Princeton and Hickory Tavern. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
